result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua T. Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joshua T. Baker in court with attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Defendant Joshua T. Baker in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CM 147, 16 CM 232.   Atty Lawton offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.   Court speaks to Mr. Baker re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds there is a factual basis.
State speaks re: sentencing.  Atty Lawton speaks to the court.  Defendant speaks to the court.  
16 CM 108
Count 1-Dismissed but Read-In
Count 2-Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 
16 CM 147-Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 

Sentencing--16 CM 108--90 Days County Jail. Credit 26 Days/Good Time/Huber + Costs
16 CM 147--2 years probation. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess of consume any controlled substances + Costs

16 CM 232--Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 

Sentencing--2 years probation. + costs
Status conference on October 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Also has 16 CM 147.  Same conditions as previous bail bonds.

Defendant Joshua T. Baker in court, in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 16 CM 147.   State requests $5000 cash in each file.  Def.

Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 16 CM 147.  No appearance by def. Final pretrial.  Jury is removed from trial.
